meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.docTitle: Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Dangerous Substances) Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Dangerous Substances) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: container (容器) means any receptacle, vessel, tank, package, bag, wrapping or other thing, whether movable or not, capable of holding any substance;
corrosive mixture (腐蝕性混合物) means a mixture that may on contact with living tissues cause severe damage to them;

def.name: DangerousMixture
def.leadIn: dangerous mixture (危險混合物) means any mixture or preparation containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: more than 1 per cent by weight of any toxic substance or substances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than 10 per cent by weight of any harmful substance or substances; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such proportion of any other listed substance or substances as makes that mixture a corrosive, explosive, flammable, irritant or oxidizing mixture;

section.def: dangerous substance (危險物質) means any substance that is a listed substance or a dangerous mixture;
explosive mixture (爆炸性混合物) means a mixture that may explode under the effect of flame or that is more sensitive to shock and friction than dinitrobenzene;

def.name: FlammableMixture
def.leadIn: flammable mixture (易燃混合物) means a mixture that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may become hot and finally catch fire in contact with air at ambient temperature without any application of energy;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a solid and may readily catch fire after brief contact with a source of ignition and that continues to burn or be consumed after removal of the source of ignition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is gaseous and flammable in air at normal pressure;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in contact with water or damp air, evolves highly flammable gases in dangerous quantities; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a liquid having a flash point below 66 degrees Celsius;

section.def: flash point (閃點) means, in relation to any liquid, the lowest temperature, if any, at which such liquid will give off vapour which will ignite or explode if mixed with air and exposed to a naked light;
harmful substance (有害物質) means any listed substance that is classified in column 2 of the First Schedule as harmful;
irritant mixture (刺激性混合物) means a mixture that, through immediate, prolonged or repeated contact with the skin or mucous membrane, can cause inflammation;
listed substance (列載物質) means any substance (whether or not a substance that is a preparation or other mixture) listed in column 1 of the First Schedule;
oxidizing mixture (助燃混合物) means a mixture that gives rise to highly exothermic reaction when in contact with other substances, particularly flammable substances;

def.name: SpecifiedIndustrialUndertaking
def.leadIn: specified industrial undertaking (指明工業經營) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any factory, mine or quarry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any premises or place in which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: articles are manufactured, altered, cleansed, repaired, ornamented, finished, adapted for sale, broken up or demolished;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: materials are transformed, including transformation in the course of shipbuilding;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: electricity or motive power of any kind is generated, transformed or transmitted; or

section.def: toxic substance (有毒物質) means any listed substance that is classified in column 2 of the First Schedule as toxic.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Commissioner for Labour may amend Schedules
section.content: The Commissioner for Labour may, by notice in the Gazette, amend any Schedule.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application
section.content: These regulations apply to any dangerous substance that is present in a specified industrial undertaking for the purpose of, in connection with, or as a result of, any industrial process or operation, but do not apply to a substance that is in the process of undergoing chemical change or of being mixed or compounded with another substance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Container holding listed substance to be labelled

subsection.content: Subject to regulation 7, every container holding a listed substance to which these regulations apply shall be labelled in accordance with regulation 9 with the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 relating to that substance.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (1) does not apply to a container holding a listed substance where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is impossible or not reasonably practicable to comply with paragraph (1) in respect of that container; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice in respect of that listed substance is displayed in accordance with regulation 10 giving the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 relating to that substance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Container holding dangerous mixture to be labelled

subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulation 7, every container holding a dangerous mixture to which these regulations apply shall be labelled in accordance with regulation 9 with the trade name of that mixture and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the mixture contains more than 1 per cent by weight of any toxic substance or substances, with the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 relating to each toxic substance that exceeds 0.2 per cent of the weight of the mixture;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the mixture contains more than 10 per cent by weight of any harmful substance or substances, with the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 relating to each harmful substance that exceeds 1 per cent of the weight of the mixture;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the mixture contains such a proportion of any other listed substance or substances as makes that mixture a corrosive, explosive, flammable, irritant or oxidizing mixture, with the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 relating to each such substance, but if the mixture contains more than one listed substance that is classified in column 2 of the First Schedule as corrosive, flammable, irritant or oxidizing, it is sufficient for the container to be labelled with the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 relating to the substance in each such classification that is the most dangerous.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (1) does not apply to a container holding a dangerous mixture where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is impossible or not reasonably practicable to comply with paragraph (1) in respect of that container; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice in respect of that dangerous mixture is displayed in accordance with regulation 10 giving the trade name of that mixture and the particulars that, but for this paragraph, would be required to be labelled on the container.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Exempt containers
section.leadIn: Regulations 5 and 6 do not apply to a container that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is clearly labelled in English and Chinese with particulars that are substantially the same as those prescribed by regulation 8 and that holds a substance that was supplied to the industrial undertaking in that container; (29 of 2021 s. 16)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is inside a package that is labelled in accordance with regulation 5 or 6, as the case may be, or in accordance with section 87 or 142, as the case may be, of the Dangerous Goods (Control) Regulation (Cap. 295 sub. leg. G); (29 of 2021 s. 16)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not intended to be used in the industrial undertaking; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: intended to be supplied elsewhere in that container; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a listed substance that is not classified in column 2 of the First Schedule as explosive, toxic, corrosive or flammable; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a dangerous mixture that is not an explosive, corrosive or flammable mixture and that does not contain more than 1 per cent by weight of any toxic substance or substances.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Required particulars
section.leadIn: The particulars required by regulations 5 and 6 relating to a listed substance are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chemical name or common name of the substance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the classification of the substance as stated in column 2 of the First Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the symbol or symbols specified in respect of that classification in column 2 of the Second Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the indication of the particular risk or risks inherent in the substance as stated in the Third Schedule opposite the number or numbers specified in respect of the substance in column 3 of the First Schedule;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the indication of the safety precautions required in respect of the substance as stated in the Fourth Schedule opposite the number or numbers specified in respect of that substance in column 4 of the First Schedule.

subsection.content: A container that is required to be labelled under regulation 5 or 6 shall be labelled in accordance with this regulation.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in English and Chinese;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the form prescribed by the Second Schedule; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in such a way that the particulars prescribed by regulation 8 can be read easily when the container is placed as it may normally be expected to be placed.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars prescribed by regulation 8 shall be clearly and indelibly marked and shall stand out sharply from their background—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a part of the container reserved for that purpose (which part shall the purposes of these regulations be treated as a label); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a label that is securely fixed to the container with its entire back in contact with the container; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where it is not reasonably practicable to comply with subparagraphs (a) and (b), on a label attached in some other suitable manner.

subsection.content:
The dimensions of the label shall be as follows—
Capacity of container
Dimensions of label
(a)
3 litres or less
not less than 50 mm × 75 mm
(b)
exceeding 3 litres but not
exceeding 50 litres
not less than 75 mm × 100 mm
(c)
exceeding 50 litres but not
exceeding 500 litres
not less than 100 mm × 150 mm
(d)
exceeding 500 litres
not less than 150 mm × 200 mm
The size of any symbol required to be shown on the label shall be not less than one-tenth of the area of the label and shall not in any case be less than 100 mm2.
A container is not labelled in accordance with this regulation if it bears particulars that do not relate to its contents and those particulars appear in a way that is confusing or misleading.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Form and place of notice
section.leadIn: A notice in respect of a dangerous substance is displayed in accordance with this regulation if (and only if)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in English and Chinese;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it identifies the container or containers holding that substance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it clearly and indelibly sets out the particulars prescribed by regulation 8;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is in a conspicuous place near the dangerous substance; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the size of any symbol required to be shown is not less than one-tenth of the area of the notice.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Safety information, training and precautions
section.leadIn: A proprietor of a specified industrial undertaking shall, so far as is reasonably practicable,—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make available to every person employed in the undertaking who works with or is likely to come into contact with a dangerous substance to which these regulations apply adequate information about any conditions necessary to ensure that the substance will be safe and without risk to the health of persons employed in the undertaking;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ensure that every person employed in the undertaking who is or may be exposed to a dangerous substance to which these regulations apply—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is trained in and observes safety precautions relating to that substance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is instructed in the purpose, proper use and limitations of any protective clothing or equipment provided; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is instructed in the health hazards associated with exposure to that substance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make arrangements, including arrangements for adequate supervision, to prevent a dangerous substance to which these regulations apply from causing bodily injury to any person employed in the undertaking.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Protective clothing and equipment
section.leadIn: A proprietor of a specified industrial undertaking shall, so far as is reasonably practicable,—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide every person employed in the undertaking who works with or is likely to come into contact with a dangerous substance to which these regulations apply with such protective clothing and equipment as are appropriate to prevent that substance causing bodily injury to that person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that such protective clothing and equipment are fully and properly used by every such person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that such protective clothing and equipment are maintained in good repair and are thoroughly cleansed after each occasion when they are used and, where any goggles, spectacles, face shield, respirator or mouth piece is provided under this regulation, that it is thoroughly cleansed and disinfected after each occasion when it is used; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide suitable storage facilities for such protective clothing and equipment.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Safety precautions to be taken and use of protective clothing
section.leadIn: Every person employed in a specified industrial undertaking where there is any dangerous substance to which these regulations apply shall, so far as is reasonably practicable,—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: follow the safety instructions given and the procedures set by the proprietor of the industrial undertaking regarding that substance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: observe the safety precautions stated on the label of the container holding that substance or on the notice displayed near that substance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take such other precautions as are reasonable to prevent that substance from causing bodily injury to himself or others;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make full and proper use of the protective clothing and equipment (if any) provided by the proprietor of the industrial undertaking; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: leave the protective clothing and equipment (if any) when not in use in the storage place provided.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Misuse of labels, notices, and protective clothing and equipment
section.content: No person employed in a specified industrial undertaking shall misuse or interfere with any label, notice, or protective clothing or equipment provided by the proprietor of that undertaking in accordance with these regulations.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Prohibition against eating, drinking and smoking
section.content: No person employed in a specified industrial undertaking who works with or is likely to come into contact with a dangerous substance to which these regulations apply shall eat, drink or smoke in any room in which that substance is present.

subsection.content: The proprietor of an industrial undertaking in respect of which regulation 5 or 6 is contravened commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.
A proprietor who contravenes regulation 11 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.
A proprietor who contravenes regulation 12 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Offences by persons employed
section.content: Any person who contravenes regulation 13, 14 or 15 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Defences
section.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence under regulation 16(1) in respect of an alleged contravention of regulation 5 or 6 it shall be a defence for any person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he took all precautions that were reasonably practicable to avoid the commission of the offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he did not have sufficient information about the dangerous substance in question to enable him to comply with regulation 5 or 6, as the case may be, and he could not by taking all reasonable steps have obtained that information.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Saving
section.content: Nothing in these regulations shall derogate from the Dangerous Goods Ordinance (Cap. 295) or from any other enactment relating to dangerous goods.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Listed Substances
schedule.text: A reference in this Schedule to a concentration range of a substance is a reference to that substance in aqueous solution, the concentration being calculated on a weight to weight basis. An entry that refers to a salt without specifying a particular form of the salt refers to both the hydrated and anhydrous forms of that salt, if any.

td.p: Acetic Acid, 25% or more but not more than 90%
Ammonia Solution with more than 35% Ammonia
Ammonia Solution with at least 10% but not more than 35% Ammonia
氨水，含氨不少於10%，但不超過35%
Amyl Alcohol, Mixed Isomers, with the exception of tert-Pentanol; Pentanol
戊醇，異構體混合物，叔戊醇除外
苄叉二氯；亞苄基二氯；α, α-二氯甲苯
過氧化苯甲醯；過氧化二苯甲醯
Beryllium Compounds with the exception of Aluminium Beryllium Silicates
鈹化合物，鋁鈹硅酸鹽除外
Butanol, all Isomers, with the exception of 2-Methyl-propan-2-ol; Butyl Alcohols
丁醇，所有異構體，2-甲基丙-2-醇除外
Butanone; Ethyl Methyl Ketone; Methyl Ethyl Ketone
Butyl Alcohol, all Isomers with the exception of tert-Butyl Alcohol (see Butanol)
丁醇，所有異構體，叔丁醇除外
Calcium Hypochlorite, concentration of Active Chlorine more than 39%
次氯酸鈣，活性氯濃度超過39%
Cellulose Nitrate; Nitrocellulose (containing a maximum of 12.6% Nitrogen)
硝酸纖維素；硝化纖維素(含氮量不超過12.6%)
氫過氧化枯烯；α, α-二甲苄基過氧化氫
鄰聯茴香胺；3, 3’-二甲氧基聯苯胺
二氯異氰脲酸；二氯-1, 3, 5-三嗪三酮
Dichloro-1, 3, 5-triazine-trione, Potassium Salt of (see Potassium Salt of Dichloroiso-cyanuric Acid)
Dichloro-1, 3, 5-triazine-trione, Sodium Salt of (see Sodium Salt of Dichloroiso-cyanuric Acid)
二亞乙基三胺；2, 2’-亞胺基二乙基胺
1, 2-二甲氧基乙烷；乙二醇二甲醚
α, α-Dimethyl- benzyl Hydroper-oxide (see Cumene Hydroper-oxide)
α, α-二甲苄基過氧化氫
二硝基甲苯，所有異構體
醋酸-2-乙氧基乙酯；乙基乙二醇乙酸酯
Formaldehyde Solution, at least 5% but not more than 30%
甲醛溶液，不少於5%但不超過30%
甲醛溶液，超過30%；福爾馬林
Formic Acid, at least 25% but not more than 90%
Hexane (Mixture of Isomers containing more than 5% n-Hexane)
己烷(含超過5%正己烷的異構體混合物)
Hexane (Mixture of Isomers containing a maximum of 5% n-Hexane)
己烷(含不超過5%正己烷之異構體混合物)
Hydrazine Solution, at least 5% but not more than 64%
肼溶液，不少於5%但不超過64%
Hydrochloric Acid, at least 10% but not more than 25%
Hydrogen Cyanide, Salts of, with the exception of Complex Cyanides such as Ferro-cyanides, Ferricyanides and Mercuric Oxycyanide
氰化氫鹽(氰亞鐵酸鹽、氰鐵酸鹽及氧氰化汞等絡合氰化物除外)
Hydrogen Peroxide Solution containing at least 20% but not more than 60% Hydrogen Peroxide
過氧化氫溶液，含過氧化氫不少於20%，但不超過60%
異佛爾酮；3, 5, 5-三甲基-2-環己烯酮
Lead Compounds with the exception of those specified elsewhere in this list
鉛化合物，在本表另有列明者除外
Mercury, Inorganic Compounds of, with the exception of Mercuric Sulphide and those specified elsewhere in this list
汞的無機化合物，硫化汞及本表另有列明者除外

汞的有機化合物，本表另有列明者除外

甲基三氯硅烷；三氯(甲基)硅烷

Nitric Acid, at least 20% but not more than 70%

Pentanol, all Isomers with the exception of tert-Pentanol (see Amyl Alcohol)
戊醇，所有異構體，叔戊醇除外
Perchloric Acid, with at least 10% but not more than 50% acid
高氯酸，含酸不少於10%但不超過50%
Petroleum Distillates and Coal Tar Distillates of complex and variable composition, flash point below 23oC
各種複雜不同成分的石油蒸餾液及煤焦油蒸餾液，閃點低於攝氏23度
Petroleum Distillates and Coal Tar Distillates of complex and variable composition, flash point equal to or greater than 23oC and equal to or less than 66oC
各種複雜不同成分的石油蒸餾液及煤焦油蒸餾液，閃點相等於或高於攝氏23度及相等於或低於攝氏66度
Potassium Cyanide (see Hydrogen Cyanide, Salts of)
Potassium Hydroxide Solution, with more than 5% Potassium Hydroxide
氫氧化鉀溶液，含氫氧化鉀超過5%

Potassium Salt of Dichloroiso-cyanuric Acid; Dichloro-1, 3, 5-triazine-trione, Potassium Salt

低亞硫酸鈉；連二亞硫酸鈉

Sodium Hypochlorite Solution, containing more than 10% Active Chlorine
次氯酸鈉溶液，含活性氯超過10%

次氯酸鈉溶液，含活性氯不少於5%但不超過10%
Sodium Salt of Dichloroiso-cyanuric Acid; Dichloro-1, 3, 5-triazine-trione, Sodium Salt

Prescribed Form of Label
限定標籤格式

tr.td: Explosive when dry
乾燥時容易爆炸
Risk of explosion by shock, friction, fire or other sources of ignition
震盪、磨擦、接觸火焰或其他火源即可能爆炸
Extreme risk of explosion by shock, friction, fire or other sources of ignition
震盪、磨擦、接觸火焰或其他火源即極易爆炸
Forms very sensitive explosive metallic compounds
形成極度敏感的爆炸性金屬化合物
Heating may cause an explosion
加熱可能引起爆炸
Explosive with or without contact with air
不論是否與空氣接觸都容易爆炸
May cause fire
可能引起火警
Contact with combustible material may cause fire
與可燃物料接觸可能引起火警
Explosive when mixed with combustible material
與可燃物料混合時容易爆炸
Flammable
易燃
Highly flammable
高度易燃
Extremely flammable
極度易燃
Extremely flammable liquefied gas
極度易燃的液化氣體
Reacts violently with water
遇水即產生強烈反應
Contact with water liberates highly flammable gases
遇水即放出高度易燃氣體
Explosive when mixed with oxidizing substances
與助燃物質混合時容易爆炸
Spontaneously flammable in air
在空氣中會自動燃燒
In use, may form flammable/explosive vapour-air mixture
使用時，可能產生易燃／爆炸性氣體及空氣混合氣體
May form explosive peroxides
可能產生容易爆炸的過氧化物
Harmful by inhalation
吸入後會對人體有害
Harmful in contact with skin
沾及皮膚後會對人體有害
Harmful if swallowed
吞食後會對人體有害
Toxic by inhalation
吸入後會中毒
Toxic in contact with skin
沾及皮膚後會中毒
Toxic if swallowed
吞食後會中毒
Very toxic by inhalation
吸入後會中劇毒
Very toxic in contact with skin
沾及皮膚後會中劇毒
Very toxic if swallowed
吞食後會中劇毒
Contact with water liberates toxic gas
遇水即放出毒氣
Can become highly flammable in use
使用時，可以變得高度易燃
Contact with acids liberates toxic gas
與酸接觸後即放出毒氣
Contact with acids liberates very toxic gas
與酸接觸後即放出劇毒氣體
Danger of cumulative effects
有累積效果的危險
Causes burns
引致灼傷
Causes severe burns
引致嚴重灼傷
Irritating to eyes
刺激眼睛
Irritating to respiratory system
刺激呼吸系統
Irritating to skin
刺激皮膚
Dangers of very serious irreversible effects
有對人體造成非常嚴重及永不復原的損害的危險
Possible risk of irreversible effects
可能對人體造成永不復原的損害
Risk of serious damage to eyes
可能對眼睛造成嚴重損害
May cause sensitisation by inhalation
吸入後可能引起敏感
May cause sensitisation by skin contact
沾及皮膚後可能引起敏感
Risk of explosion if heated under confinement
在密封情況下加熱可能爆炸
May cause cancer
可能引致癌症
May cause heritable genetic damage
可能造成遺傳性的基因損害
May cause birth defects
可能引致先天性缺陷
Danger of serious damage to health by prolonged exposure
長期接觸可能嚴重危害健康
Spontaneously combustible in air when wet
當潮濕時，在空氣中會自動燃燒
Reacts violently with water, liberating highly flammable gases
遇水即產生強烈反應，並放出高度易燃氣體
Contact with water liberates toxic, highly flammable gas
遇水即放出有毒及高度易燃氣體
Harmful by inhalation and in contact with skin
吸入或沾及皮膚後都對人體有害
Harmful by inhalation, in contact with skin and if swallowed
吸入、沾及皮膚或吞食後都對人體有害
Harmful by inhalation and if swallowed
吸入或吞食後都對人體有害
Harmful in contact with skin and if swallowed
沾及皮膚或吞食後都對人體有害
Toxic by inhalation and in contact with skin
吸入或沾及皮膚後會中毒
Toxic by inhalation, in contact with skin and if swallowed
吸入、沾及皮膚或吞食後會中毒
Toxic by inhalation and if swallowed
吸入或吞食後會中毒
Toxic in contact with skin and if swallowed
沾及皮膚或吞食後會中毒
Very toxic by inhalation and in contact with skin
吸入或沾及皮膚後會中劇毒
Very toxic by inhalation, in contact with skin and if swallowed
吸入、沾及皮膚或吞食後會中劇毒
Very toxic by inhalation and if swallowed
吸入或吞食後會中劇毒
Very toxic in contact with skin and if swallowed
沾及皮膚或吞食後會中劇毒
Irritating to eyes and respiratory system
刺激眼睛及呼吸系統
Irritating to eyes, respiratory system and skin
刺激眼睛、呼吸系統及皮膚
Irritating to eyes and skin
刺激眼睛及皮膚
Irritating to respiratory system and skin
刺激呼吸系統及皮膚
May cause sensitisation by inhalation and skin contact
吸入或沾及皮膚後都可能引起敏感
Keep locked up
必須緊鎖
Keep in a cool place
存放在陰涼地方
Keep away from living quarters
切勿放近住所
Keep contents under . . . (appropriate liquid to be specified)
容器內的化學品必須保存在 ___________ (須指定適當液體)
Keep under . . . (inert gas to be specified)
保存在 ___________ (須指定適當的惰性氣體)
Keep container tightly closed
容器必須蓋緊
Keep container dry
容器必須保持乾燥
Keep container in a well ventilated place
容器必須放在通風的地方
Do not keep the container sealed
切勿將容器密封
Keep away from food, drink and animal feeding stuffs
切勿放近食物、飲品及動物飼料
Keep away from . . . (incompatible materials to be indicated)
切勿放近 __________________ (須指定互不相容的物質)
Keep away from heat
切勿受熱
Keep away from sources of ignition—No Smoking
切勿近火——不准吸煙
Keep away from combustible material
切勿放近易燃物質
Handle and open container with care
處理及打開容器時，必須小心
When using do not eat or drink
使用時，嚴禁飲食
When using do not smoke
使用時，嚴禁吸煙
Do not breathe dust
切勿吸入塵埃
Do not breathe gas/fumes/vapour/spray (appropriate wording to be specified)
切勿吸入氣體／煙霧／蒸氣／噴霧(須指定適當字眼)
Avoid contact with skin
避免沾及皮膚
Avoid contact with eyes
避免沾及眼睛
In case of contact with eyes, rinse immediately with plenty of water and seek medical advice
如沾及眼睛，立即用大量清水來清洗，並盡快就醫診治
Take off immediately all contaminated clothing
所有受污染的衣物必須立即脫掉
After contact with skin, wash immediately with plenty of . . . (to be specified)
沾及皮膚後，立即用大量 __________________ (須予指定)來清洗
Do not empty into drains
切勿倒入水渠
Never add water to this product
切勿把水加入這種物品
Take precautionary measures against static discharges
採取措施，防止靜電發生
Avoid shock and friction
避免震盪和磨擦
This material and its container must be disposed of safely by . . . (to be specified)
這種物質及其容器必須由 __________________ (須予指定)安全地棄掉
Wear suitable protective clothing
穿著適當的防護衣物
Wear suitable protective gloves
戴上適當的防護手套
In case of insufficient ventilation, wear suitable respiratory equipment
如通風不足，則須配戴適當的呼吸器
Wear eye/face protection (appropriate wording to be specified)
配戴護眼／護面用具(須予指定適當字眼)
To clean the floor and all objects contaminated by this material use . . . (to be specified)
使用 __________________ (須予指定)來清理受這種物質污染的地板及物件
In case of fire and/or explosion do not breathe fumes
遇到火警及／或爆炸時，切勿吸入薰煙
During fumigation/spraying wear suitable respiratory equipment (appropriate wording to be specified)
進行煙薰／噴霧時，配戴適當的呼吸器(須指定適當字眼)
遇到火警時，使用 __________________ (在空位上註明應該使用何種滅火設備；如果用水會增加危險，加註——“切勿用水”)
If you feel unwell, seek medical advice (show the label where possible)
如感不適，應就醫診治(可能的話，出示有關標籤)
In case of accident or if you feel unwell, seek medical advice immediately (show the label where possible)
遇到意外或感到不適時，立即就醫診治(可能的話，出示有關標籤)
If swallowed seek medical advice immediately and show this container or label
誤吞後立即就醫診治，並出示此容器或標籤
Keep at temperature not exceeding . . . °C (to be specified)
存放溫度不超過攝氏 _________ 度(須予指定)
Keep wetted with . . . (appropriate material to be specified)
以 __________ 保持濕潤(須指定適當物質)
Keep only in the original container
祇可存放在原用的容器內
Do not mix with . . . (to be specified)
Use only in well ventilated areas
祇可在通風的地方使用
Not recommended for interior use on large surface areas
不宜在室內施用於表面闊大的物件

td.i: 各種安全措施的配合運用

tr.td: Keep container tightly closed, in a cool well ventilated place
容器必須蓋緊，存放在陰涼通風的地方
Keep in a cool well ventilated place
存放在陰涼通風的地方
Keep in a cool, well ventilated place away from . . . (incompatible materials to be indicated)
存放在陰涼通風的地方，切勿放近 ___________ (須指明互不相容的物質)
Keep only in the original container in a cool, well ventilated place away from . . . (incompatible materials to be indicated)
祇可存放在原用的容器內，並放在陰涼通風的地方，切勿放近 ___________ (須指明互不相容的物質)
Keep only in the original container in a cool, well ventilated place
祇可存放在原用的容器內，並放在陰涼通風的地方
Keep in a cool place away from . . . (incompatible materials to be indicated)
存放在陰涼的地方，切勿放近 ___________ (須指明互不相容的物質)
Keep container tightly closed and dry
容器必須蓋緊，保持乾燥
Keep container tightly closed and in a well ventilated place
容器必須蓋緊，並存放在通風的地方
When using do not eat, drink or smoke
使用時，嚴禁飲食或吸煙
Avoid contact with skin and eyes
避免沾及皮膚和眼睛
Wear suitable protective clothing and gloves
穿著適當的防護衣物，並戴上適當的防護手套
Wear suitable protective clothing, gloves and eye/face protection (appropriate wording to be specified)
穿著適當的防護衣物，並戴上適當的防護手套及護眼／護面用具(須指定適當字眼)
Wear suitable protective clothing and eye/face protection (appropriate wording to be specified)
穿著適當的防護衣物，並戴上適當的護眼／護面用具(須指定適當字眼)
Wear suitable gloves and eye/face protection (appropriate wording to be specified)
戴上適當的手套及護眼／護面用具(須指定適當字眼)
Keep only in the original container at temperature not exceeding . . . °C (to be specified)
祇可存放在原用的容器內，溫度不得超過攝氏 _________ 度(須予指定)
